chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K
c: AbsRing.sort K
a: nat -> V

Goal:
ex_series a -> ex_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a n))

Premises:
Notation AbsRing := AbsRing.type
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) => exists l : V, is_series a l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
scal = fun (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K) => ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : forall (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K), K -> V -> V Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted
AbelianGroup.sort = fun t : AbelianGroup => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbelianGroup -> Type AbelianGroup.sort is a coercion
ex_series_Rabs : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series (fun n : nat => Rabs (a n)) -> ex_series a
is_series_scal : forall (c : K) (a : nat -> V) (l : V), is_series a l -> is_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a n)) (scal c l)
is_series_scal_l : forall (c : K) (a : nat -> V) (l : V), is_series a l -> is_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a n)) (scal c l)
ex_series_plus : forall a0 b : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 -> ex_series b -> ex_series (fun n : nat => plus (a0 n) (b n)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_opp : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 -> ex_series (fun n : nat => opp (a0 n)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_minus : forall a0 b : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 -> ex_series b -> ex_series (fun n : nat => plus (a0 n) (opp (b n))) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
Series_plus : forall a b : nat -> R, ex_series a -> ex_series b -> Series (fun n : nat => a n + b n) = Series a + Series b
Series_minus : forall a b : nat -> R, ex_series a -> ex_series b -> Series (fun n : nat => a n - b n) = Series a - Series b
ex_series_ext : forall a0 b : nat -> ?V, (forall n : nat, a0 n = b n) -> ex_series a0 -> ex_series b where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_incr_1 : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 < -> ex_series (fun k : nat => a0 (S k)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_incr_n : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (n : nat), ex_series a0 < -> ex_series (fun k : nat => a0 (n + k)%nat) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_series_le : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (b : nat -> R), (forall n : nat, norm (a0 n) <= b n) -> ex_series b -> ex_series a0 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
ex_series_Reals_0 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l}
ex_series_Reals_1 : forall a : nat -> R, {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l} -> ex_series a
Series_incr_1 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> Series a = a 0%nat + Series (fun k : nat => a (S k))
is_series_opp : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (la : ?V), is_series a0 la -> is_series (fun n : nat => opp (a0 n)) (opp la) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
is_series_plus : forall (a0 b : nat -> ?V) (la lb : ?V), is_series a0 la -> is_series b lb -> is_series (fun n : nat => plus (a0 n) (b n)) (plus la lb) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
Cauchy_ex_series : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 -> Cauchy_series a0 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
ex_series_Cauchy : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, Cauchy_series a0 -> ex_series a0 where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
Series_correct : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> is_series a (Series a)
ex_series_dec : forall a : nat -> R, {ex_series a} + {~ ex_series a}
filterlim_scal_l : forall (k : ?K) (x : ?V), filterlim (fun z : ?K => scal z x) (locally k) (locally (scal k x)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
filterlim_scal_r : forall (k : ?K) (x : ?V), filterlim (fun z : ?V => scal k z) (locally x) (locally (scal k x)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
norm_sum_n_m : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (n m : nat), norm (sum_n_m a0 n m) <= sum_n_m (fun n0 : nat => norm (a0 n0)) n m where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K c : K a : nat -> V |- NormedModule ?K]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n

```coq
intros.
exists (scal c l).
apply is_series_scal.
assumption.
Qed.
